item.title: Brandon Clifford creates heavy concrete sculptures that sway and roll

img.alt: Walking Assembly by Matter Design Studio

item.dc:creator: Jenna McKnight
item.description: American designer Brandon Clifford has drawn inspiration from megalithic architecture to create concrete sculptures that seem to defy gravity as they move. Read more
item.content:encoded: American designer Brandon Clifford has drawn inspiration from megalithic architecture to create concrete sculptures that seem to defy gravity as they move. Read more

item.title: Mikhail Riches creates energy-efficient terraced streets as social housing in Norwich

img.alt: Goldsmith Street by Mikhail RichesGoldsmith Street by Mikhail Riches

item.dc:creator: Lizzie Crook
item.description: Goldsmith Street is a Passivhaus and high-density social housing scheme by Mikhail Riches in Norwich, England, which is shortlisted for this year's Stirling Prize. Read more
item.content:encoded: Goldsmith Street is a Passivhaus and high-density social housing scheme by Mikhail Riches in Norwich, England, which is shortlisted for this year's Stirling Prize. Read more

item.title: Studio José de la O reveals objects designed by brainwaves

img.alt: Studio José de la O reveals objects designed by brainwaves

item.dc:creator: Alyn Griffiths
item.description: Designer José de la O has teamed up with technology firm Mirai Innovation to develop a way for people to manipulate the shape of a vase using only their thoughts. Read more
item.content:encoded: Designer José de la O has teamed up with technology firm Mirai Innovation to develop a way for people to manipulate the shape of a vase using only their thoughts. Read more

item.title: Patent applications filed to claim ownership of designs for a machine
item.dc:creator: Augusta Pownall
item.description: Patent applications have been filed on behalf of a machine called Dabus that used AI to design a plastic food container and a flashing light. If successful it would be the first time a machine has been recognised as the owner of a design by patent offices. Read more
item.content:encoded: Patent applications have been filed on behalf of a machine called Dabus that used AI to design a plastic food container and a flashing light. If successful it would be the first time a machine has been recognised as the owner of a design by patent offices. Read more

item.title: Rafał Barnaś creates an "abstract world built out of paper" for animated film ArchiPaper

img.alt: ArchiPaper movie: A surrealist story about architecture by Rafal Barnas

item.dc:creator: Tom Ravenscroft
item.description: Rafał Barnaś has used digital animation to create a world that resembles moving paper cutouts for an upcoming movie, which will tell the story of a house in Poland designed by his brother. Read more
item.content:encoded: Rafał Barnaś has used digital animation to create a world that resembles moving paper cutouts for an upcoming movie, which will tell the story of a house in Poland designed by his brother. Read more

item.title: Aesop store in south Seoul is a cosy red-brick retreat

img.alt: Aesop Sounds Hannam store designed by Mlkk Studio

item.dc:creator: Natasha Levy
item.description: Mlkk Studio used reclaimed red bricks to fashion the snug interiors of this Aesop store, which lies behind the intimidating dark-grey facade of a building in Seoul. Read more
item.content:encoded: Mlkk Studio used reclaimed red bricks to fashion the snug interiors of this Aesop store, which lies behind the intimidating dark-grey facade of a building in Seoul. Read more

item.title: Francesca Molteni creates film to celebrate Italian ceramics

img.alt: Dezeen promotions: Ceramics of Italy video

item.dc:creator: Dezeen staff
item.description: Dezeen promotion: Film director Francesca Molteni has created a movie for Ceramics of Italy that spotlights the story of Italian ceramics. Read more
item.content:encoded: Dezeen promotion: Film director Francesca Molteni has created a movie for Ceramics of Italy that spotlights the story of Italian ceramics. Read more

item.title: Robin Day's 675 chair given modern makeovers for fundraising auction
item.dc:creator: Alyn Griffiths
item.description: Fifteen leading textile designers have created their own interpretation of Robin Day's iconic 675 chair, which will be auctioned in aid of the Robin and Lucienne Day Foundation. Read more
item.content:encoded: Fifteen leading textile designers have created their own interpretation of Robin Day's iconic 675 chair, which will be auctioned in aid of the Robin and Lucienne Day Foundation. Read more

item.title: Four jobs for urban designers including positions at Arup and Studio Egret West

img.alt: Queen Elizabeth Quay bridge in Perth, Australia by Arup Associates

item.dc:creator: Cara Bray
item.description: This week we've selected four opportunities for urban designers on Dezeen Jobs, including positions at engineering firm Arup and architecture practice Studio Egret West. Read more
item.content:encoded: This week we've selected four opportunities for urban designers on Dezeen Jobs, including positions at engineering firm Arup and architecture practice Studio Egret West. Read more

item.title: Layan wraps Light House in a screen of illuminated metal discs

img.alt: Light House by Layan in Melbourne, Australia

item.dc:creator: Jon Astbury
item.description: A dynamic screen of illuminated, rotating polycarbonate discs shield the upper level of this home in Melbourne, completed by Layan for the director of local lighting design practice The Flaming Beacon. Read more
item.content:encoded: A dynamic screen of illuminated, rotating polycarbonate discs shield the upper level of this home in Melbourne, completed by Layan for the director of local lighting design practice The Flaming Beacon. Read more
